space_data = space_data.drop(["Unnamed: 0", "Unnamed: 0.1"], axis=1)

space_data.rename(columns={"Company Name": "Company", "Datum": "Date & Time", "Detail": "Rocket Name",
                           "Status Rocket": "Rocket Status", " Rocket": "Mission Cost", "Status Mission": "Mission Status"},
                  inplace=True)
source.a7f18381:
space_data["Date & Time"] = pd.to_datetime(space_data["Date & Time"], utc=True).dt.tz_localize(None)

space_data["Rocket Status"] = space_data["Rocket Status"].replace({"StatusActive": "Active", "StatusRetired": "Retired"})

space_data["Mission Cost"] = space_data["Mission Cost"].str.replace(",", "").astype(float)

comp_mission_count_df.reset_index(drop=True, inplace=True)

comp_mission_count_df.loc[comp_mission_count_df.index.max() + 1] = ["Others", space_data.shape[0] - comp_mission_count_df["No. of Missions"].sum()]

source.ed6a1341:
def max_miss_loc_comp(data):
    loc = data["Location"].str.split(", ").str[-1]
    max_loc = loc.value_counts().sort_index().idxmax()
    max_loc_miss = loc.value_counts().sort_index().max()
    max_loc_data = data[loc == max_loc]
    max_loc_comp = max_loc_data["Company"].value_counts().sort_index().idxmax()
    max_loc_comp_miss = max_loc_data["Company"].value_counts().sort_index().max()
    
    return pd.Series({"Location": max_loc, "No. of Missions": max_loc_miss,
                  "Company": max_loc_comp, "Missions": max_loc_comp_miss})

source.b654ecd0:
def top_comp_loc(data):
    
    tot_miss = len(data)
    max_comp = data["Company"].value_counts().sort_index().idxmax()
    miss = data["Company"].value_counts().max()
    max_comp_data = data[data["Company"] == max_comp]
    succ_rate = round(sum(max_comp_data["Mission Status"] == "Success")/len(max_comp_data)*100, 2)
    
    return pd.Series({"Total Missions": tot_miss, "Company": max_comp, "Missions": miss, "Success %": succ_rate})

source.c0fbe5c3:

    ids=ids,
    labels=labels,
    parents=parents,
    hoverinfo="text",
    hovertext=hovertext
))

fig.update_layout(title={"text": "Top Space Company for each Location", "x": 0.5}, height=650)

fig.show()
source.078c718a: * **Since there are very few missions which have "partially failed" or "failed before launch", they have been accounted as "failed missions".**
source.63015016:
**Facts :** * **Russia** has launched the most number of missions and has hosted about **8** different space companies.
**RVSN USSR** has hosted a staggering **1198** missions for Russia followed by **VKS RF** which has hosted about **157** missions.
The remaining **6** space companies have combinedly hosted **40** missions for **Russia**.

* **USA** has hosted the most number of space companies with **16** companies.
**General Dynamics** has launched the most number of missions for USA with **251** missions followed by **NASA** with **203** missions.
**US Air Force**, **ULA**, **Boeing**, **Martin Marietta** and **SpaceX** have each launched atleast **100** missions.

* **Kazakhstan** has hosted about **10** different space companies.
**RVSN USSR** has launched the most number of missions for Kazakhstan with **579** missions followed by **Roscosmos** with **47** missions.

* For **China**, most of its missions were launched by **CASC** with **250** missions.

* For **India**, all its missions were launched by **ISRO**.
source.1a4b1e9c:
**Facts :** * **ULA** which has launched **140** missions has a mind-blowing **success rate** of **99.29%**.

* **Arianespace** which has launched **279** missions has a **success rate** of **96.42%**.

* **Boeing** which has launched **136** missions is just behind **Arianespace** with a **success rate** of **96.32%**.

* **MHI** which has launched **84** missions has a **success rate** of **95.24%**.

* **SpaceX**, **Lockheed**, **VKS RF**, **CASC**, **NASA** and **RVSN USSR** each has a **success rate** of atleast **90%**.

* **RVSN USSR** which has launched a whopping **1777** missions has a success rate of **90.83%** which is amazing.

* Although **RVSN USSR** has **163** failed missions, its **failure rate** of **9.17%** is lesser than **US Air Force**, **General Dynamics**, **ISRO** etc.
source.9c577d4b:
## Data
**The data contains the details of all Space Missions from October 1957 - August 2020.**
**Let's take a look at the first few rows in the data.**
source.7964e3aa:
**Facts :** * Around **93%** of the **active** rockets are **successful**.
Around **5%** of the **active** rockets have **failed**.
The remaining **active** rockets have either **partially failed** or **failed before launch**.

* Around **89%** of the **retired** rockets are **successful**.
Around **8.5%** of the **retired** rockets have **failed**.
The remaining **retired** rockets have either **partially failed** or **failed before launch**.
source.33474fd9:
* **The first 5 companies with the most number of missions are termed as 'Top 5'.**
* **The graph describes the number of missions launched by the Top 5 Space Companies in each year from 1957 to 2020.**
source.a5368386:
**Facts :** * **China** has the most number of **active** rockets followed by **USA**.

* **Russia** has the least number of **active** rockets followed by **Kazakhstan**.

* **Russia** also has the most number of **retired** rockets followed by **USA**.

* **China** has the least number of **retired** rockets followed by **France**.
source.4385054c:
**Facts :** * It is obvious that **RVSN USSR** is way ahead of the other space companies from **1962** to **1992**.

* Post **RVSN USSR's** final mission in **1992**, **Arianespace** has launched most missions among the other space companies from **1993** to **2002**.
Again, the company has launched most missions from **2009** to **2015**.

* From **2016** to **2020**, **CASC** has launched the most number of missions than the other space companies.

* After **2011**, only **Arianespace** and **CASC** have been **active** among the **Top 5** space companies in terms of launching missions.
source.60a87247: * **The graph describes the Space companies which has launched the most number of missions in each year and the number of missions launched by the company in that year.**
source.7e2a8936:
**Facts :**

* Out of all rockets launched, over **80%** of the rockets are **retired** while less than **20%** of the rockets are still **active**.

<hr>
source.6a86a9e6:
**There are 4324 rows and 7 columns in the data. Each row corresponds to a mission.**

**The column details :** * **Company** - name of the space company * **Location** - location of the launch * **Date & Time** - date and time of the launch * **Rocket Name** - name of the rocket * **Rocket Status** - status of the rocket * **Mission Cost** - cost of the mission in million $ * **Mission Status** - status of the mission

source.33166ea0:
**Facts :** * The year **1957** in which the **first ever space mission** was launched saw the least number of total missions with only **3** missions.

* Each year from **1965** to **1978** saw around **100** space missions which includes **119** missions in the year **1971** which is the **most number of missions** launched in an year ever.

* From **1979** to **2015**, the count of the number of missions each year was not as much as it was from **1965** to **1978**.

* From **2016 to 2019**, the number of missions in each year is around **100** and the count will mostly be maintained once the year **2020** ends
in which over **60** missions has been launched as of the first week of **August**.

* In **2018**, a whopping **117** missions were launched in total which is the most number of missions launched in an year after **1971**.
source.e31c9d70:
**Facts :** * The most number of mssions were launched in **Q4-2018** with **39** missions.

* Atleast **35** missions were launched in **Q4-1970**, **Q2-1971**, **Q4-1971**, **Q4-1973**, **Q2-1975**, **Q3-1977**.
source.e15ec44b:
**Facts :** * **Russia** is way ahead of the other 4 locations from **1968** to **1991**.

* **USA** has launched the most number missions in each year from **1958** to **1963**.
Again, **USA** has launched the most number missions in each year from **1992** to **2017**.

* **China** has been launching the most number of missions in each year from **2018** to **2020**.

* Only in **2012**, **Kazakhstan** didn't launch even a single mission.

* **France** has never launched the most number of missions in an year among the top 5 locations inspite of having the **highest success rate**.
source.f546e082:
**Facts :** * The most number of missions were launched in **December 1971** with **18** missions.

* Atleast **15** missions were launched in **April 1968**, **October 1970**, **April 1975**, **September 1975**, **July 1976**, **September 1977**,
**December 2018** and **December 2019**.

source.d4cf4f8b:
**Facts :** * **USA** has launched the most number of missions in an year **33** times.
**Boeing** and **ULA** has launched the most missions for **USA** in an year **11** and **10** times respectively.
In **2017**, **USA** launched the most number of missions with **SpaceX** launching **18** out of the **30** missions launched by USA.

* **Russia** has launched the most number of missions in an year **23** times.
Without surprise, **RVSN USSR** has launched the most missions for **Russia** all those times.
Another mindblowing fact is that **RVSN USSR** has launched all the missions for **Russia** from **1969** to **1990**.

* **Kazakhstan** has launched the most number of missions in an year **5** times.
**RVSN USSR** has launched the most missions for **Kazakhstan** all those times.

* **China** has launched the most number of missions in an year **3** times.
**CASC** has launched the most missions for **China** all those times.
In **2018**, **China** launched the most number of missions with **CASC** launching **37** out of the **39** missions launched by China.

**Facts :** * The year **2018** saw the most number of **successful** missions with **113** out of 117 missions launched being successful in the year.
The **success rate** of the year was **96.58%**.

* The years **1971**, **1975**, **1976**, **1977**, **2018** and **2019** each saw atleast **100** successful missions.
The years **1976**, **1977** had a **success rate** of over **95%**.
The years **1975**, **2019** had a **success rate** of over **90%** while the year **1971** had a **success rate** around **88%**.

* In terms of **success rate**, the year **1983** was the most successful with a **success rate** of **98.48%**.
**65** out of **66** missions launched in the year were **successful**.

* The years **1973**, **1975**, **1976**, **1977**, **2018** and **2019** launched over **100** missions and each had a **success rate** of atleast **90%**.

source.ef07d23f:
**Facts :** * **RVSN USSR** has launched most of its missions in **December** followed by **October**.
The company has launched least number of missions in **January**.

* Similarly, **Arianespace** and **Genral Dynamics** has launched most of its missions in **December** and least number of missions in **January**.

* **CASC** has launched most of its missions in **November** and least number of missions in **February**.

* **NASA** has launched most of its missions in **November** and least number of missions in **August**.

* Each of the top 5 space companies has launched most of its missions either in **November** or **December**.

* Each of the top 5 space companies except **NASA** has launched the least number of missions either in **January** or **February**.
**NASA** has launched least number of missions in **August**.
source.589d8d27:
**Facts :** * **US Air Force** has launched the most number of missions for **4 consecutive years** from **1959** to **1962**.
In **1962**, the company has launched **41** missions which is its highest in an year.

* **RVSN USSR** has launched the most number of missions in an year **30** times which includes a staggering **29 consecutive years** from **1963** to **1991**.
The company has launched atleast **50 missions per year 17** times in total.
In **1977**, the company has launched **97** missions which is the highest by any company in any year.

* **VKS RF** has launched the most number of missions for **3 consecutive years** from **1992** to **1994**.

* **Boeing** has launched the most number of missions in an year **5** times.

* **Arianespace** has launched the most number of missions in an year **7** times which includes **3 consecutive years** from **2000** to **2002**.

* **ULA** has launched the most number of missions in an year **7** times which includes **6 consecutive years** from **2009** to **2014**.

* **CASC** has launched the most number of missions in an year **5** times which includes **3 consecutive years** from **2018** to **2020**.
source.51e13432:

It has a **success rate** of **93.41%** for **Russia** and **85.49%** for **Kazakhstan**.

* **General Dynamics** is the top space company for **USA**. The company has launched **251** missions for **USA** with a **success rate** of **80.88%**.

* **CASC** is the top space company for **China**. The company has launched **250** missions for **China** with a **success rate** of exactly **92%**.

* For **France**, **Arianespace** has launched the most number of missions with **277** missions and has a staggering **96.39% success rate**.

* **MHI** has launched the most number of missions for **Japan** with **84** missions and has a **success rate** of **95.24%**.

* For **India**, **ISRO** has launched all its **76** missions with a **success rate** of **82.89%**.

* **ISRO** has exactly **50 active** rockets out of its **76** rockets launched.
